content:
@Floris van Doorn, I am responding here to avoid flooding the PR.

Some of the old names matched the naming of mul_inv_cancel_right + siblings (mul_inv_cancel_left, inv_mul_cancel_left, inv_mul_cancel_right).

I know and I tried to preserve this heuristic, but I found it less precise than appending _eq_(left/right). Feel free to offer concrete suggestions though (in the shape of the same table as in the PR description with the three subrows collapsed if you want :pray:).

it's a bit unfortunate that in the new naming scheme the GroupWithZero lemmas don't have the "default name" anymore, since they are the more commonly used ones.

This decision largely predates this PR. The ₀ is better because if lemma X doesn't apply to your situation, then you can always add ₀ and try again. In comparison, primes are overloaded, so there's no guarantee you will hit the correct lemma by adding '.

Thread in a more visible place: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/renaming.20basic.20Group.28WithZero.29.20lemmas

Please note that I'm happy with the changes, but I would like this to not suddenly change, and then people being unhappy with the new names and propose a different (better?) naming scheme.
